name: 2018/11/06 Dinner Chicke Gizzard
description: This 2018/11/06 Dinner Chicken Gizzard recipe is perfect for those seeking a high-protein, low-carb, and high-fiber meal. It's designed to nourish your body and satisfy your taste buds while sticking to your healthy eating goals. Featuring tender chicken gizzard, crunchy carrots, fresh asparagus, and a rich blend of garlic and ginger, this dish is a hearty and healthified option for any dinner.
recipeIngredient: 300 g Chicken, gizzard, all classes, raw

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the chicken gizzards under cold water and then trim any excess fat.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the carrots into thin slices and the asparagus into bite-sized pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Mince the garlic and ginger root.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: In a pot, bring water to a boil and blanch the asparagus for 2-3 minutes, then remove and set aside. This should take about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat and saut√© the minced garlic and ginger until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chicken gizzards to the pan and cook until they are browned on all sides and nearly cooked through, approximately 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sliced carrots to the pan, sprinkle with salt, and cook for an additional 10 minutes or until the carrots are tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: While the gizzards and carrots are cooking, boil the large egg to your desired doneness, peel, and then slice.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8

recipeInstructions.text: Once the gizzards and carrots are done, add the blanched asparagus to the pan and heat everything together for another 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 9

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the chicken gizzard mix with slices of boiled egg on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 10
